column4: I'm trying to use Komodo edit, which I just installed. But the binary says that "there are no applications available to open executable" -- I have checked "allow executing program as file". what should I do?
try reinstalling Komodo Edit
don't use a .sh in a terminal
use apt-get and uninstall Komodo, then install it using apt again
I'll give that a try, thank you
I'm sorry, that's not working. I did not get Komodo through apt, nor is it available through ubuntu repositories
http://www.activestate.com/komodo-edit
Yes, that is what I'm using
have you browsed the settings?
it does not seem to have support for executable files
I'm not trying to work with executables, I'm attempting to run the komod binary
Komodo*
komodo does not seem to have the binary codecs necessary
have you browsed the settings?
I cannot start the program, so I don't know how I would browse settings
uninstall it then...
I've uninstalled and reinstalled several times, same issue =(
try another editor
I'll let you know what I find out, in case anyone else asks
Figured it out. I'm a dumb dumb and downloaded the 32-bit installer rather than 64-bit
Installing the 64-bit version solved my problem, thanks for your help
glad you found the problem :P
